TopicTitle: this is what happenes when you mess around with Scram jets and Advanced turboramjets.....

Articles.Content:
no kidding i combined the 2 most op air breathing jets and this is where it threw me.......

![7f6a3f64a4743a0fd1ffd9b8865ca69e.png](https://i.gyazo.com/7f6a3f64a4743a0fd1ffd9b8865ca69e.png)

This is how much fuel i spent not that much /\ /\ /\

![c732f57554ea0edbc1d1b4a0adddebc4.png](https://i.gyazo.com/c732f57554ea0edbc1d1b4a0adddebc4.png)

It thew me into a aporapsis of 581,152.2 !!!! 

well i tried to land it but my plane went kablweie on a hill but jeb and bill survived a top speed of 2453.6 re-entry!

It's quite possible to do kerbin escapes with the Instell Scramjets.

If you fly a shallow ascent from 20km onwards until your apoapsis hits 40km, then coast to 40km and go full throttle towards the horizon.

hmm, nice would like to use this, 

where can I find the scram jet mod/advanced turbojets Mods??

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119735-1-0-4-Instell-Incorporated-Experimental-Technologies](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119735-1-0-4-Instell-Incorporated-Experimental-Technologies)

I recommend using community tech tree and applying your own config to take them to the back end of the tree, so's they're actually hard to get to - by default they are much too easy to get for the power they're offering. IMO ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> ...a file named ***instell-ctt.cfg*** placed in the root Instell directory with the following contents will do the job:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     @PART[XE101Scramjet]:NEEDS[CommunityTechTree]{  // 1500, end of tree    @TechRequired = expAircraftEngines}@PART[XE202Scramjet]:NEEDS[CommunityTechTree]{    // 1500, end of tree    @TechRequired = expAircraftEngines}@PART[HyperIntake]:NEEDS[CommunityTechTree]{  // 1500, end of tree    @TechRequired = expAircraftEngines}@PART[XE404]:NEEDS[CommunityTechTree]{    // 550, between turbojets and rapiers    @TechRequired = hypersonicFlight}
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ...
